entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS DEVELOPING WITH SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW CHANGING TO RAIN TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... In Washington, Foothills of
entry.cap:areaDesc: Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued January 01 at 11:33AM PST until January 02 at 12:00PM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Visibility less than one mile in dense fog. * WHERE...Davenport, Coeur d`Alene, Downtown Spokane, Hayden, Post Falls, Fairfield, Spokane Valley, Airway Heights, Cheney, Worley, and Rockford. * WHEN...Until noon PST Tuesday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 6:17PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUE THROUGH TONIGHT... Snow showers will gradually taper off along and near the mountains overnight tonight, with half an inch of additional snow accumulation possible. Slick spots could develop, particularly on elevated surfaces and untreated roads. Snow showers may also reduce visibility. If
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 4:53PM EST until January 02 at 12:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations 1 to 2 inches. Storm total accumulation of 3 to 5 inches. * WHERE...Eastern Preston and Eastern Tucker Counties. * WHEN...Until midnight EST tonight.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 1:26PM EST until January 02 at 12:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett County. In West Virginia, Western Grant County. * WHEN...Until midnight EST tonight.
